detail: Hello!We are looking for a new flatmate to rent a room in our lovely home!The house:Room Rent - ¬£775 per monthBills come to roughly ¬£115 - ¬£125 a monthFlexible move in date, but need to fill before January 1st.The room is a spacious double in a Victorian terraced house. Comes with a double bed, wardrobe and set of drawers. We have a lovely living room and kitchen where we hang out. Kitchen fully equipped + dish washer (yay!). 2 full bathrooms. Separate laundry room with washing machine and dryer. There are actually 5 bedrooms in total, giving us a spare bedroom for if family/friend want to visit (we don‚Äôt rent this out in respect to the landlords who keep the rent decent for us in exchange of keeping this room free). Nice tall ceilings across the house. Alex‚Äôs favourite point to show off is our lovely garden, which is fairly huge and grows beautiful roses, grape vine and wildflowers in the spring.We are located within 15 minute walk of both Seven Sisters (Victoria line) and Turnpike Lane (Piccadilly line) tube stations. Can get you to Kings cross in 30 min and easily into central London very fast.Also a couple minutes walk from multiple nice parks, Tesco and Sainsbury‚Äôs. 15-20 minute walk to couple big Tescos/sainsbury/aldi - up for the choosing!Us & house vibes:We are three working professionals in our late 20s/ early 30s, so looking for someone similar. We are pretty chill generally as people. We keep a clean house overall and divvy up the cleaning that needs to be done. We are friendly and sociable whilst being respective of peoples space. Love a good pub trip or film/game night when we can but also happy to just chat over making dinner or slump on the sofa to watch some tv together after a long work day.‚Ä®‚Ä®Alex (27- she/her) is originally American but has lived in the UK for 20 years. She works in Arts education and enjoys art, going to the pub, board games, and bagels. Jackson (30 - he/him) is from New Zealand. He works in the public sector and enjoys video games, watching Liverpool or a good series. Or (28 - he/him) grew up in the Netherlands. He is a doctoral student who used to enjoy reading until starting a PhD, running, and watching a good film.Drop us a message for more info and we can schedule a viewing! Room will be available from Jan 1.‚Ä®‚Ä®Cheers!‚Ä®Alex, Or and Jackson

detail: We have a lovely large room to rent with a view of our garden. It should be free from the second or third week in January. There is an original fireplace, a double bed with room underneath for storage, plenty of shelving, a small wardrobe and a clothes rail  and a little desk by the window that overlooks our garden. This is for just one person, not a couple, owing to pressure on the bathroom and kitchen.The room is in a terraced house just off Church Street. I own the house and live here with my 19-year-old daughter and our dog. Sorry, we can‚Äôt take any other pets ‚Äì he is quite enough for us to manage! As we are an all-female household we feel more comfy with another female. We‚Äôve shared our house with many lodgers over the years. We find that those who fit best often have busy lives of their own, as we do but we enjoy a chat in the kitchen as we come and go. I‚Äôm an ad creative and my daughter is currently on a gap year.There‚Äôs a kitchen with a dishwasher, a downstairs loo and an upstairs bathroom with a bath with a shower. There‚Äôs also a utility room. No tumble dryer.It‚Äôs a great location, just off Church Street but near the High Street. We are very close to Abney Park and Clissold Park is just a wander away past all the shops and cafes of Church Street. A little further is the famous Castle Climbing Centre and open water swimming reservoir. The leisure centre is nearby for indoor swimming, gym etc. There‚Äôs the Farmers Market at the weekend in the High Street. Transport links include buses on Church Street (73 heading for Angel and central London, the 393 to Highbury) buses on the High Street,(149 up to Seven Sisters tube or down to Dalston), Stoke Newington station is near.The rent is ¬£750, paid by direct debit. . The deposit is one month‚Äôs rent, paid in advance. The bills are ¬£140 a month which include utility bills, broadband, council tax, ( band E) TV licence, water. However, if the monthly usage on the utility bills increases then there will be additional charges. We don‚Äôt usually put the heating on during the working weekday. We all clean the house.A reference from an employer is required. We have had many people sharing our house with us over the years and especially love those from other countries. We find that people who have busy independent lives tend to fit best in the house. Sorry, there isn‚Äôt storage space outside your room other than a few pots and pans in the kitchen. There are bike storage units in the street which you can rent from the council.Drop me a message if you think you might like living here and fit in well, we really enjoy meeting people from other countries and people with interesting hobbies.

detail: EXTRA LARGE DOUBLE ROOM IN HARRINGAY N4 - with double bed available in a young, friendly, non-smoking house-share. High coved ceilings, bright and very spacious. This period property is located in a quiet, tree-lined road. A fully fitted kitchen - upstairs and downstairs extra-large luxury showers - a comfortable lounge overlooking a south facing garden - GCH and WiFi.The house is close to Underground stations, National Rail stations, buses, shops, banks, caf√©s, gyms, libraries, bars, restaurants and pubs.TRANSPORTHarringay N4 has excellent transport links, such as the Piccadilly and Victoria lines, which will take you into Central London within 20 mins.Harringay Train Station, (Great Northern Rail), is only 8 minutes walk away and goes to Finsbury Park, Highbury & Islington, Kings Cross, Old Street - terminating at Moorgate Station in just 15 minutes.(Another nearby London Overground station, Harringay Green Lanes, is on the Barking to Gospel Oak Suffragette line).There are great bus connections to the City and West End. The 24-hour buses 341, 141 and 29 go to Waterloo, London Bridge and Trafalgar Square via Camden Town..THE AREAHarringay N4 is a trendy, vibrant area in North London and has a multitude of independent shops and culinary delights on Green Lanes high street - many of which are open 24hrs, 7 days a week.  You‚Äôll love the Dusty Knuckle Bakery, the cool Brouhaha cocktail bar and the recently opened Sushi Co. which offers late night deliveries. You won't find a more delicious Sunday roast than that served by Stamp Brasserie - with free top-ups of potatoes and veg !Fancy a pint? Check out The Old Ale Emporium and The Salisbury tavern - which also includes a Chinese restaurant, Little Dragons.Time for some shopping therapy - the Arena Retail Park is a 10 minute walk - Aldi, Sainsbury's, Argos, TK Maxx, Sports Direct, Next, Costa Coffee, McDonald's etc.Wood Green Shopping Mall is one of the largest in London and only 10 mins away by bus - shops galore!  The Mall also includes a Cineworld Cinema and a large Market Hall which has a fantastic selection of small independent traders, selling everything from fashion and beauty products to electricals and quick bites to eat. Whatever you‚Äôre looking for you‚Äôll find in the Market Hall. Oh, and just up the road near Wood Green Station is a 6-screen, state-of-the-art Hollywood Vue Cinema complex.Harringay also has numerous nature trails - and includes the Railway Fields Nature Reserve, (only 8 mins walk from the house) - described as a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle - a haven for wildlife with over 200 plant species, 60 bird species and 21 types of butterflies.A 15 min walk will take you to the famous Finsbury Park which has a boating lake, skate park, outdoor gym, caf√©; basketball, netball, and volleyball courts ‚Äì  a venue for festivals, concerts, fun fairs, circus‚Äôs and displays.Also close by are the open spaces of Woodland Park, Wetland Reservoirs, Cissold Park, Chestnuts Park, Downhills Park, Stationers Park, Priory Park and Lordship Recreation Ground.For the active amongst you, there are gyms and fitness centres nearby - and the Castle Climbing Centre is only 10 mins away by bus.A must visit is Alexandra Palace, (Ally Pally as it‚Äôs affectionately known). From this impressive Grade II listed building you get a beautiful, panoramic view of London. It includes an ice-rink (with skating lessons if you wish), the Palm Court Atrium and The Phoenix pub. This iconic venue has hosted film premieres, Red Bull racing, boxing, snooker, ice hockey and darts. Previous live gigs include The Rolling Stones, Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin and the London Symphony Orchestra. Other events at Ally Pally include theatre, arts & crafts & food festivals, exhibitions, podcasts, panel discussions, workshops and tours. Something for everybody ! Alexandra Park Station is a mere 5 minute journey from Harringay Station.Please make contact to arrange a viewing ASAP!!      :  )

Available now.East Finchley, London N2If you like your own privacy and own order to things this is a completely private, very cozy, warmly heated lodging without sharing with others- shared entrance hall only.Please note It is a lodger room within my property not an annex or a separate studio flat with it's own address.The rest of my flat is only occupied by myself and my quiet, easygoing 7-year-old.Thanks for reading ‚Äî most key info is covered.INTRO LODGER DETAILSTo receive a quicker reply, please include:Ideal move-in date + intended length of stayWhere you work/study (home or office)Nature of job/professionNationality + time in UK (if recently arrived)Smoker or non-smokerMale or female (not always obvious from names)Anything else worth mentioning is welcome!THE KITCHENETTE within the lodger room:Double electric hob has an extractor properly vented outside! With the window open for circulation, food smells don‚Äôt linger.Great size sink, built-in washing machineMini fridge with tiny freezer (there is under counter space for second freezer unit if needed).Microwave not provided but can be considered if needed. A lot of people bring their own appliances, and then I've got nowhere to store unwanted items from the lodger room.Electric kettle and basic crockery provided, one small pot and streamer pot provided. You'll need to bring your own pots and pans if needing more then what's provided.EN-SUITE BATHROOMCompact en-suite bathroom with rain shower, loo, wall cabinet, shelve, hooksLODGER ROOMDesk & chair, wall and floor laundry racks, 2x Ikea wall-pocket shoe storage.Above-the-door storage for 2‚Äì3 very large suitcases.Bolt lock on door for privacy when in the room.Loft bed has 135cm wide mattress. There's 183cm clearance underneath to stand up straight!Not everyone loves a high sleeper; a regular bed can be added or setup re-arranged if preferred.No bedding included (can borrow pillows, duvets, covers and sheets if needed short-term for a small fee).Room always warmly heated in winter ‚Äî it‚Äôs the warmest room in the property.LOCATION7-min walk to East Finchley tube Northern line.1 min walk to High Street.Small garden accessible occasionally via shared lounge/bedroom/playroom by prior agreement (e. g., for drying large laundry).SHORT STAYS- RE-ADVERTISING FEE EXPLAINEDBecause I don‚Äôt lock people into strict year-long contracts, it offers you the flexibility of a shorter stay ‚Äî six months is preferred, but as little as two/three months can be agreed ‚Äî without the commitment of a full year.The re-advertising fee (already part of listed deposit) is essentially the cost of that flexibility- finding new lodgers more often is both costly and time-consuming. I‚Äôm flexible on when you leave, except notice period cannot run during December and August please, July may be ok, more below.The ¬£125 re-advertising fee applies to stays of 12 months or less and is fully refunded if you stay 13 months or more.---NOTICE PERIODOne full CALENDAR month‚Äôs notice is required i. e. You give notice latest at end of one month then the notice period runs from the 1st to the 31st of the following month.I ask notice period is not to run during the following months due to busy school holidays and potential travel plans thus my unavailability to arrange viewings to replace you: December, July & August.Your understanding and planning to avoid these months is greatly appreciated, and this will be part of the lodger agreement.NOTESA short-term lodger may potentially stay in our adjacent bedroom on occasion ‚Äî this has never happened before and likely won‚Äôt; mentioned for transparency ‚Äî it would have no impact on your privacy in the self contained lodger room.3 BASIC HOUSE RULES1- Please remove outside shoes either just outside the front door or as you enter to help keep the hall clean.2-Close the front door gently ‚Äî a soft click is enough; no need to slam or push hard.3- There's no curfew ‚Äî come and go as you please. Just kindly keep noise to a minimum at all times.Partial Council Tax Band D included.Any questions welcome, feel free to message me.

Ever had your own towpath and canal and river frontage before? Take a look!A tranquil gem in North London. Lovely bright and private 2 bed flat, situated in natural grounds on it's very own wharf surrounded by water, and boasting excellent transport links to central London, Stratford, the City, and north to Stansted and Cambridge.UPDATE:**Availability from 15th November**** The bigger room / room 1 is available, I am currently moving out of my lovely, spacious, vibrant and cozy current two bedroom flat in Tottenham Hale and so am searching for someone to take over start to middle of November!The smaller or larger room is available for you to choose from, my current flatmate is flexible on that. You will be sharing with a 29 year old professional guy who is studying for a PhD in Economics currently. He is a very easy going, chill, tidy, respectful flatmate and appreciates respecting other people‚Äôs space and privacy whilst still being sociable and outgoing.The flat itself is located in a really good place, buzzing area, peaceful, convenient transport link, lots of stores, cafes, spacious, lots of nature too surrounding as well as a gorgeous canal.If interested send me a text asap :)The flat is cosy (50 Sqm) and bright, easily accessible on the ground floor, with the privacy of all windows looking out onto the communal garden and bushes on either side. The flat is furnished, and there are 2 bedrooms, one larger and one small double; one bathroom with bath and shower, and a bright open plan lounge and kitchen.The flat is on Bream Close, which is in the lovely grounds of Heron Wharf, a private development with a single entrance, and natural grounds. There is private canal frontage and towpath on one side, and a tree lined river on the other. The Walthamstowe Wetlands (Europe's Largest Urban Wetland) are across the river - great for walks, followed by good coffee and tasty pastries at the EngineRoom coffee shop. There is fantastic wildlife, including plenty of birds, ducks and swans.Outside the Bream Close bubble, there is plenty of eclectic north London vibe. The area boasts an increasing number of breweries, bars and coffee shops. The Ferryboat Inn is a great pub just over the road, the Beehive is another lively gem in towards Tottenham, and the Post Bar is great for later nights. The area has a nice buzz with both student accommodations, and many newbuilds around.There are excellent local amenities - Tottenham Hale Train and Underground station about 7 minutes walk; a Tesco 5 minutes walk, a The Gym 5 mins walk, the Tottenham Retail Park with various shops under 10 minutes walk, and a GP surgery within about 5 minutes walk. If you swim, there is a full size pool and leisure centre about a 10 min run/5 min cycle/10 min bus away.Transport links are excellent: 123 Bus stop 1 minute away in the main road. From Tottenham Hale Station (7 min walk) you can get to Oxford Circus in 16 minutes on the Victoria Line, Kings Cross in 11 min; to Liverpool St in 15 min, Stratford in 13 min, and Stansted Airport in 36 min.The total for the available smaller room is paid monthly in advance and comprises ¬£832 for rental, the bigger room is also paid monthly in advance and comprises ¬£982 (includes the service charge for the development, and water) and ~¬£150 for bills. The deposit is ¬£1000.(Total rent for the whole flat equates to ¬£2114 including bills)The bills comprise of:* Council Tax* superfast broadband* Gas + Elec* References will be requested.Thanks! I look forward to hearing from you.Shiraz

Large Bright Double sized room for a Single person @¬£1065 in this beautiful Warehouse Apartment in Manor House, N4. Zone 2.We have an upcoming vacancy for a single person in a spacious warehouse conversion, a bright large double sized room, with furniture - double bed,  1 x chest of drawers, large built-in cupboard, black wooden shelving units, glass desk top and a wheel‚Äôy-swivel chair, with wooden floors with plenty of space for work area and masses of natural light, 1 huge 3 meter wide, recently new double glazed window.The room is double sized, approximately 6m long x 3m wide x 2.7m high, and provides a spacious and comfortable bright area for both working space and/or relaxation space.Monthly rent for a single person is ¬£1065pcm including council tax, 1,000 mbps  wi-fi, and  water.Additional monthly costs are gas and electricity, which varies on season but averages around ¬£65. (gas & electricity prices have  increased a lot), plus ¬£27.50 per month for a regular cleaner and ¬£10 pcm for house kitty for house materials.The warehouse conversion is unique as it is a raised clear-storey so we have no adjoining neighbours on our level and large windows on all sides - so welcome sunrises and enjoy beautiful sunsets when clearer skies, with wooden floors through-out.We have 6 others in the house, 4 guys & 2 girls, involved in architecture, music, design, performance art/theatre and hospitality - it‚Äôs spacious and full of light and we love it.The place works nicely as we all get on well and sometimes enjoy an occasional dinner together, or outings/outside events, yet have ample separate private rooms to have time to ourselves in our own spaces for our work or chill time.It‚Äôs a comfortable home and not a party house.There is also a big open plan communal lounge, with lots of plants and loads of daylight along with a dining/kitchen area of approximately 70 sqm.Here there is a first rate kitchen with an excellent kitchen range with 5 hobs and double oven, 6 fridges, one fridge per room, plus a drinks fridge and 2 freezers with large work surfaces and a vast array of catering equipment and a huge 2.5x1.5 meter glass  dining table - home-designed, to enjoy and socialize at.So plenty of space to chill and interact/chat with others in the house or withdraw to your own space.There is a wonderful double shower in main bathroom with w/c and basin and a second toilet with w/c, basin and wash/drying room with an 8kg washing machine and a dehumidifier for quick drying on those wet winter days.There is a back garden area we share with our neighbouring unit below us, with a barbecue, seating, etc to enjoy warm evenings outside and lots of greenery beyond as we have woodland behind the warehouse apartment.Along with a vegetable patch where we can grow a variety of veg.The complex has it‚Äôs own private parking and is lit, with electronic entrance gate for vehicles and pedestrians and very secure.The Complex.Our warehouse was the first conversion here but the complex is now home to about 250/300 creatives, and feels like a little oasis.We're additionally connected to other warehouse complexes across the area for interactive activities, yoga, life drawing, parties etc, so are part of a 700-800 strong "scene".Prior to Covey we also started to have community based mini festivals and arts events etc.It really is a friendly and great place to live.Local Facilities.Shopping complex with Sainsburys, Argos, Superdrug, TK Maxx, A Gym etc etc. 8 min walk away, a late opening off-license/grocers, pizza joint 3 min away etc.Buses from the shops run to Stoke Newington, Camden, Islington, Old Street, Liverpool Street, there‚Äôs actually very good transport to everywhere.12 min walk Manor House tube ‚Äì Piccadilly line (kings Cross 15min).12 min walk Seven Sisters tube ‚Äì Victoria line (Victoria 20mins).9 min walk Stamford Hill and Green Lanes over-ground (Liverpool St 20 Mins).*24hr Buses - Camden 15min, Angel 15min, Old Street 20min, Stoke Newington 5min, Finsbury Park 6 min.The late night walk back here is safe as the surrounding residential streets are cordoned off and are mainly family homes.There were a number of great local music venues eg. "The Finsbury" in Manor House and the ‚ÄúJam in a Jar‚Äù and the famous Salisbury pub in Green Lanes plus others.Also Great local restaurants, Turkish, Thai, Chinese, Italian, Ethiopian, Eritrean, Sushi and  many others.Other.Great swimming pool / gym by Clissold Park, and great walks/runs in the area with Woodberry Wetlands nature reserve with East and West reservoirs - providing sailing, swimming and water sports, Finsbury Park and Parkland Walk nature reserve - the old railway line up to Highgate.The extensive Lea river walks with endless walks in fields and woods.Also for those interested in climbing we have the Castle climbing centre nearby.If you are interested in the place please drop us a line or call us on the mobile number or e-mail provided.

Hi  there,We  have a 2 decent size double rooms  in  ever  popular  Haringey  area  (Rutland  Gardens),  in  a terraced  house  with  a  garden  and  off  street  parking.  The rooms are available from 17th December 2025 and 2nd January 2026.The  property  is  located  in  a  residential  street.  All  the  shops  are  practically  on  your  door  step:  24  hour  Sainsbury's,  Iceland,  Tesco  and  many  local  groceries.  Most  Turkish  shops  are  open  24  hours.  You'll  be  surrounded  by  lots  of  nice  restaurants,  bars  and  cafes.  Honestly,  you  can  never  starve  in  this  area  :)  Finsbury  Park  with  a  free  outdoor  gym  is  only  a  5  min  walk.  It's  lovely  to  go  for  a  run  in  the  morning. There are several local gyms in the area. Wood  Green  shopping  centre  is  just  10  min  by  bus  or  a  smaller  shopping  centre  in  Harringey  Arena  is  a  2  min  walk.Extremely  good  transport  connections  to  Central  London.  The  tube  station  is  only  7 - 10 min  walk  and  there  are  lots  of  buses  available:  29,  141,  341,  253,  254,  279.  (Victoria  and  Piccadilly  lines  run  a  24  hour  service  on  Fri  and  Sat).  There  are  night  buses  also:  29,  341, 259  and  253.There  are 2 males and 1 female living  in  the  house  at  the  moment,  all  working  professionals.  We  are  from Ukraine and Albania.  We  are  friendly and respectfu flatmatesl,  looking  for  somebody  similar  who  is  clean  and  tidy.The  atmosphere  in  the  house  is  very  important  to  us.  We  are  looking  for  somebody  who  is  considerate  and  respects  other  people,  their  privacy  and  gets  on  well  with  others, who  CLEANS  after  her/himself, does not spend entire day/evening on a loudspeaker, does not make noise and does not slam the doors.  There  are  certain  rules  in  the  house  like  no  smoking  (if  you  smoke,  you  can  only  do  so  outside  -  this  is  very  strict).  We  also  have  a  cleaning  rota,  that we all respect, and  cleaning  products  collection  once  every  3  months  -  it's  approximately  ¬£1 per month.The  house  is  quite  spacious and there are days you probably won't see anyone.  There  is  a  kitchen  and  a  separate  living  room  with  a  sofa,  armchair,  dining  table,  etc.  The  kitchen  is  large  with  many  cupboards  - you  will  have  enough  space  for  your  stuff.  We have  2  fridges and a fairly new  combi  boiler.  The  heating  works  well and so does  hot  water.  All  windows  are  double  glazed (some were replaced in December 2023).We  have  2  bathrooms:  1  with  a  bath  tub,  another  one  with  just  a  shower  (not  using  it  really  as  the  main  bathroom  is  nicer)  and  a  separate  WC  on  the  ground  floor. There  is  a  small  private  rear  garden which is great to use in summer and is very useful for drying the laundry.The larger room is on the ground floor. It has a bay window and gets lots of light. It is furnished with a new double bed, a wardrobe, 2 chest of drawers, a desk and a table, a sideboard, a shelving unit and a mirror. The curtains are proper blackout curtains.The second room is also on the ground floor and has a garden view (side). It comes with a double bed, a wardrobe, a  desk, a  chair, a shelving unit and a mirror. A new chest of drawers can be provided (the current flatmate brought her own).The rent is ¬£780pm and ¬£880pm inclusive of bills.  Please note that the gas and electricity are included up to the maximum of ¬£85pm per person. In the unlikely event of exceeding this amount in winter (which has not happened yet), we will need to contribute/split the amount above ¬£85pm. Also, if you watch TV or watch TV programmes on your phone/laptop, you will need to get your own TV licence.1  month  deposit  which  goes  towards  your  last  month's  rent  (so  it's  not  a  deposit  but  your  last  month's  rent)  plus  1  month's  rent  are required  to  move  in.The  minimum  stay  is  3  months.  Short  let  can  also  be  considered at a slightly higher rate.  When  you  decide  to  move  out  you  will  need  to  give  a  1  month's  notice the day before your rent is due.  To  reserve  the  room  ¬£100  holding  deposit  will  be  required  (you  will  get  a  receipt).  The  rest  will  be  paid  on  the  moving  in  day  (minus  ¬£100).  Professional  people  and  students  preferably,  please.Please note that there is a restaurant next door, which means that you might hear the staff disposing of rubbish in the bins - could be late at night - for a few seconds - as well as some early morning food deliveries - around 7 am.Please  email  me  if  you  have  any  questions  or  if  you  would  like  to  arrange  a  viewing.For  a  fast  response text, Whatsapp  or  Viber  messages  would  be  best.  Sorry, I  do not take calls during working hours and do  not  listen  to  the  voice  mail,  therefore,  please kindly  do  not  leave  any.Thank  you.Hope to meet you soon.Nataliya

detail: 3 Bedroom flat in an incredible location in Old Street/Hoxton for ¬£3100 excluding bills.*Please note the landlord insists on keeping one room a communal living room lounge. Requests to repurpose this as a 4 bedroom without a lounge will be rejected.This flat is a ground floor flat with access to a communal private "garden/outdoor area". Plus you have the extra benefit of the front door patio/outside area too.Flat sits within a gated car park so it's very secure. Neighbours are a lovely mix of young professionals, families and retirees. Everyone is very friendly and bonus lots of them have friendly dogs which are a joy to bump into.TRANSPORT:It has brilliant transport links to Old street station (10 minute walk) and Hoxton station (5 minute walk) along with plenty of bus routes in walking distance.NEIGHBOURS & THE AREA:Really vibrant area with loads of great parks (Shoreditch Park/Hoxton Square) nearby and not far from the canal if you enjoy a stroll by the water. Loads of great cafes and restaurants, it's within walking distance from Columbia road flower market, and some awesome bars like Ballie Ballerson, Blues Kitchen, the Breakfast Club. Plenty of other fun stuff too if you're not into the night life. Lots of convenient stores like Iceland and Poundland a stone throw away.PARKING:As mentioned, the flat sits parallel to a gated car park. The flat doesn't have a designated parking spot, but you can apply for a parking disc with the council and parking is first come first served.THE FLAT:Furnished.Each bedroom comes with a bed, chest of of drawers, and the larger rooms have standalone wardrobes.Living room has couch, chest of drawers and small eating tableThere is one toilet and a separate bath/shower room.There are 3 cupboards/storage closets in this flat so plenty of storage space.Monthly rent: ¬£3,100Deposit: ¬£3576Deposit + 1st months rent to be paid before move in date.References required.Bills not included. Tenants must pay for gas, water, council tax, and broadband.To give you a previous indication of bills, the previous tenants roughly paid around +- ¬£310 per monthCouncil tax +- ¬£150Water +- ¬£55Electricity/gas +- ¬£75Broadband +- ¬£30Landlord is looking for tenants under one contract rather than individual room contracts.Ideally looking for a 12 month (minimum) contract with a 6 month break clause (means you may be liable to find a replacement if you decide to leave before 6 months, after 6 months you just need to give 1 months notice).Possibly the best thing to mention is the amazing landlord. She is really considerate and reactive to her tenants needs!If you're interested please drop me a note, let me know a bit about you and when you're looking to move. Look forward to hearing from you!

An academic who is still working in research and writing. Her interests include following current affairs, particularly social and community issues, politics and music (she plays classical guitar daily and listens to Classic FM), languages (she speaks Spanish and French). She likes to read The Economist and listen to BBC Radio 4 and go for a daily walk. She has some mobility difficulties following an accident and she uses a wheeled walker when walking outside.She is in regular close contact with her children and grandchildren and she meets up with friends every week.She is mostly vegetarian and cooks herself a simple meal in the evenings. She is however open to sharing with a non-vegetarian. She has her food delivered weekly and there is not much in terms of space in the kitchen and fridge for storage so this opportunity will not suit somebody who comes with a lot of equipment and groceries or who likes to batch cook, but rather someone who is happy to make or heat up something fresh daily.Our homeowner is looking to share her home with a compatible, interesting younger person (most probably in their 20s, 30s or 40‚Äôs) who is working or perhaps doing a PhD. Our homeowner would prefer to share with a female.Practical help might include putting shopping away, emptying the bins, light housework such as tasks that the homeowner finds difficult, watering the plants, helping with IT, local errands if needed, locking up at night.She would be delighted to share a few meals and some company and conversation some evenings or maybe watch a good documentary or home/garden /nature programme and possibly go on some local walks together. An overnight reassuring presence is essential so we are looking for somebody who would expect to stay in the home most nights and would not have too many travel commitments.The ideal sharer will be kind and companionable, happy, clean and tidy, flexible and helpful. Someone mostly working out of the home during the day or on a hybrid basis and who enjoys a quieter, calm lifestyle. A non-smoker.We are looking to match this Homeshare opportunity soon. If it is of interest, please message us telling us about yourself, your work/study situation, and interests, and particularly why you consider that you would be well suited to this Homeshare. Thank you.COST ** ¬£199 per month**This is a monthly facilitation fee for our matching and ongoing monitoring service. You do NOT pay any rent to the Homeowner. Bills ¬£100 per month.We are a social enterprise facilitating Homeshare matches across London and surrounding areas. We match people who live alone and need some practical support and company, with mature adults wanting affordable accommodation who are happy to provide some companionship and practical support in return for a safe place to live. No personal care is permitted.

Hi there! I'm looking to sublet a lovely room in a 2 bed 2 bath flat share in Angel as my flatmate is moving out to move in with her partner, and I love the flat and the area and keen to stay. The room is available from 1st February. The contract runs until 30 Nov 2026 - with option to extend with our landlord beyond.I'm looking for a single person rather than a couple, and someone who wants to live in a really lovely and well maintained flat, and keep a very friendly and considerate atmosphere, and look after it!The room / flatIt's a furnished and spacious double room with lots of storage space and its own separate private bathroom (down the hall) in a really well maintained and looked after modern flat. We have a really spacious sitting room & dining room with floor to ceiling windows/French door, and a separate kitchen with modern appliances. The flat is located on the 5th floor and has great views of the city. There are only 2 flats per floor, and 6 floors in total, with a communal garden area, so it has a nice, secure feel to it and everyone in the building is always friendly.The monthly payment to the landlord is ¬£1,229 each (¬£1,198 rent + ¬£31 broadband), and monthly bills come to around ¬£175 each on top of this (breakdown below). All in all this means total monthly rent and bills come to ~¬£1,403.- Rent + broadband pp ¬£1,229- Council tax pp ¬£103- Energy bill pp ¬£47- Water bill pp ¬£26Current flatmateI am Dominika and have lived in the flat for 5 years (in London for >10) and know the area really well. I am friendly and very active - play basketball a couple of times a week in a local league, cycle and run around the local area, enjoy walks around London, eating out, and travel - often jetting around on holidays, visiting family in Poland or friends abroad. I work as a management consultant and am generally in the office but will also work from home a couple of times a week. Both bedrooms have space for desks and so my flatmate and I both tend to work from our rooms.Who I am looking forI am ideally looking for a female professional aged 28+ who's lived in flatshares before, is respectful and friendly. I am not looking for couples or long term partners low-key moving in. Would like to keep a very friendly atmosphere in the flat, and someone who is looking for the same. The flat isn't a party house, but on occasion we can fit ~6-8 people around the table for a dinner party.The areaThe areas is fantastic. Upper Street and Angel are on your doorstep, as is Regent's Canal and Dalston / Hackney / Shoreditch, and you are also so close to the city. The flat is located on a quiet road and only a 5 minute walk from Essex Road station. The neighbourhood has so much going on - we're really close to some lovely spots, some of our favourites are the bakeries Pophams and Quince, Devotion for coffee and the Earl of Essex and Duke of Cambridge pub. Upper Street is also a short walk away (10 mins), as well as Angel Station and Highbury & Islington (10-15 min walk) where there are so many more shops, restaurants, cafes and amenities.Transport linksEssex Road station is a 5 minute walk away (trains connect to Highbury & Islington and Moorgate), or it's a 10-15 minute walk to Angel Station (Northern Line) and Highbury & Islington (Victoria Line, Overground). If you cycle it's incredibly convenient and centrally located, e. g. 20 minutes to get into Soho/Central. We also have very convenient bus routes taking you straight into the City/London Bridge/Soho/Central/Kings Cross.Note on building worksIt is worth noting that there are works to remove cladding in our wider building complex (which means there are builders around on weekdays creating some noise during the day - usually 8am until about 4pm).However, the works have been already completed on our building (no more scaffolding!) and in the final stretch overall  due to be finished before you move in in February.ViewingsPlease message if you're interested or have any questions, I'll be looking to arrange viewings on the weekend of 6/7th Dec and/or over the course of the following week.

detail: Hello!We have a lovely, bright double room now available in our fantastic non-smoking home, just a 10-minute walk from Turnpike Lane station (Piccadilly Line: 20 minutes to central London). The house is situated in a very quiet residential area: Belmont with local parks and shops nearby.The room:A small single on the top floor of the house. It comes furnished with a small wardrobe, shelves, a big chest of drawers and a single bed. It has a sash window and lots of light. It faces a quiet road.At the moment, the room has a bunk bed, which creates more space, but there is the option to keep it or replace it with the single bed.The house:The house is a beautiful end-of-terrace home with many original period features which make it extra special. We have a big living room with three sofas and a wide-screen smart TV (Freeview, Firestick), a large kitchen (gas hob, electric oven, air fryer, fridge freezer, microwave, toaster, washing machine, dining table), a bathroom with shower, and a second toilet downstairs. We‚Äôre lucky to have a lovely garden (perfect if you‚Äôre into gardening!). We also have broadband (700Mb) and gas central heating.We‚Äôve really made this house into our home so it would suite someone who is looking for a calm and comfortable environment. There‚Äôs a lovely atmosphere here ‚Äì we respect each other‚Äôs space and belongings, and we all do our bit to keep the house clean and tidy at all times.The area:The street has a great community spirit and there‚Äôs a street party every year. It‚Äôs mostly settled families living here, so it‚Äôs peaceful and quiet. We‚Äôre a short walk from Turnpike Lane tube and there are loads of handy bus routes nearby ‚Äì the 24-hour 243 takes you directly to Stoke Newington, Dalston, Old Street and on to Waterloo / South Bank. Within walking distance we have: Green Lanes (delicious Turkish food, independent shops and bars); Crouch End (nice cafes, restaurants, cinemas); Wood Green (large stores and supermarkets); and Alexandra Palace which is great for walking and has stunning views across London.The housemates:One female (Slovakia) and two males (UK/Colombia) in our 30s and 40s. One of us has lived in this house for 18 years (it really is that good!). We are employed as: a graphic designer/photographer; a financial administrator and a film editor.Our interests include cooking, gardening, music, film, football, yoga, meditation, music festivals. We all get on well and it‚Äôs very important to us that we maintain the lovely, respectful family atmosphere that we have here. Now and then we‚Äôll get together for a movie, a barbecue in the garden or a Sunday roast ‚Äì but we also appreciate time alone to do our own thing.We‚Äôre early risers so the house is quiet after 10pm on week-nights (and generally too, to be honest) so if you want somewhere to party and play loud music late at night then this isn‚Äôt the place for you.We‚Äôre looking for someone who will fit right in and is genuinely looking for the kind of home we have here. If this sounds like you then please get in touch!To apply for a viewing please tell us a bit about yourself and why you‚Äôd like to move in with us, and we‚Äôll get back to you.Rent: ¬£445 per monthBills: ¬£166 per month (Council Tax, Gas, Electricity, Water, broadband, TV licence, household cleaning products, communal kitchen essentials)Deposit: ¬£450The estate agent will require references to carry out a credit check: no feeTotal cost to secure room and move in: ¬£1061

üåûDOING INTERVIEWS FIRST WEEK OF JANUARY FOR A JAN/FEB MOVE-IN DATEüåûABOUT THE PLACE:We have a large downstairs communal area with a pool table, football table, piano and bar, there is an upstairs mezzanine/second lounge, 3 showers, 1 bath, and 3 toilets, an exercise/art room with some equipment and a mirror wall and even a spare room for guests.We have two outside spaces where we like to hang out, have drinks and sunbathe in the summer, including a decking area with plenty of plants and an additional little sun trap at the side of the house. We also have access to the communal bike shed if needed. The room comes unfurnished and you can decorate the room however you wish.The room is on the first floor of the house. There is no lift so the room is accessible only by stairs. There is a step to get into the property, 15 steps to get to the 1st floor and then an additional 2 steps to get to both the bedroom and the bathroom. There are also 2 toilets/showers on the ground floor. There is no intercom system at the property. Please note that we don‚Äôt smoke in any of the communal indoor areas in the house or the bedrooms.Rent is ¬£825 a month (including bills and a cleaner) + ¬£10 kitty for cleaning supplies. First and last month‚Äôs payment is due before moving in as well as a refundable ¬£50 deposit.Universal Credit is accepted but all new tenants are required to provide proof of income before moving in (whether that is employment or UC).ABOUT US:There weren't the options on the listing to add accurate numbers but there are 13 of us total :) We are a fun and friendly bunch and a spectrum of genders all in our 20s and 30s. Lots of us dabble in multiple different professions including people who work in the world of gardening, theatre, music, set design, comedy, painting, rigging, writing, hospitality and tech.We‚Äôre all pretty sociable and while everyone has different schedules and lives outside the house, we do socialise together a fair bit. We love a movie night, binge-watching the Traitors, pot luck dinners or BBQs in the summer. We will often have friends over or go to events together however, we‚Äôre not a party house - we tend to go elsewhere for parties! Although we will throw a big one on occasion e. g. for birthdays.ABOUT YOU:We really love our home and are all pretty committed to making it a nice place to live - both in terms of doing work on the house and in trying to keep up good communication and a kind, supportive vibe. We‚Äôd love to find someone who is also keen to get stuck in and call this place home. We welcome all genders, sexualities, nationalities and personalities but you must be kind and caring towards others, we aim to prioritise making the flat a safe space for all. No couples.Congrats if you've made it this far! If you‚Äôre interested, please get in touch with a short message telling us a bit about yourself with a fun fact or two.We're looking forward to hearing from you üôÇ x

Hi!We have a great double room to rent in our flat in Highgate. It's on the top floor so has plenty of light and very nice views of the local parks. It is less than 10 minutes walk from highgate tube station, and only 12 minutes on the tube to Euston station.The room has a large double bed, a desk/personal workspace, and plenty of storage with a built-in wardrobe. The flat is fully furnished, and the room come complete with new feather pillows and bedding, so if you have just arrived in London and don't have these kinds of furnishings, we have it all covered.I have just finished my PhD in anthropology at UCL, so I am often working from home and can be found at my desk in my own personal study space in my bedroom. While I do sometimes listen to music to keep myself focussed, the flat has particularly good soundproofing and you can't hear any music in the bedrooms.In the bathroom we have a great power-shower as well as a full-sized bathtub. We have a compact but practical kitchen with all essential amenities, including a washing machine and a dryer.Please note that this is a smoking household, and cigarettes are allowed to be smoked inside the house. This is an important point for us, so please ensure this isn't a problem for you. The flat is unlikely to be suitable for non-smokers who are sensitive to cigarette smoke, or people with asthma/lung problems.While we are a very work-driven household, we do occasionally enjoy a social evening or dinner sometimes at the weekend, which you are most welcome to join.The room is available from the 5th of December until the 5th of March 2026. Rent is ¬£900 per month, including all bills and a cleaner - the price is for a single-person occupancy of an ample double room. We are willing to consider couples- though we would need to have a conversation first to ensure everyone is a good fit. For Couples: please note that rent would need to be adjusted to factor in costs of an extra person.If this all sounds good and you would like to come and have a look around, please get in touch and we can arrange a viewing at a time that is convenient for you. I am happy to schedule viewings at any time throughout the day or evening - so don't worry if you have unusual working hours, we can work around that and find a time that suits everyone.I look forward to hearing from you, and hope to meet our new flatmate soon.Best,Raffaella

detail: Hello, Sophie, Alex and Elliot here,We have a sunny double room available in a big 4 bedroom house on the Harringay ladder.NOTE the photos are from a while back to illustrate what you can fit into the room. Messages that just ask to view will be ignored.*****We are looking for someone to sign a new tenancy with the two existing housemates so we're looking to find the right person, relatively quickly. You'll need to go through reference checks with the agency and all that jazz.*****Apologies but we can't have pets due to allergies.HOUSEMATESThe house is made up of three other friendly professionals who are like a mix of social chats, films, pub visits and also tend to do their own thing. Hobbies include comedy, cinema, crafts, photography, interior design, politics, gardening and all things related to plants!We'd love to find someone who will treat the house as a home, especially as it comes unfurnished and every now and again we need to replace shared items. You get bonus points if you're up for helping out in the garden as it grows quickly! We would also prefer people who work hybrid or in the office although it doesn't need to be a deal-breaker.You would be sharing with Sophie, 35 (me) who loves gardening and interior design, and works hybrid for a charity, and Alex, 39, who is a participation lead in a social enterprise. Elliot has just joined us and is keen to create a social vibe :)We have a living room with a TV, and a dining room, garden with a patio and lawn, two toilets and a bathroom. There are wooden floors throughout the ground floor. There isn't a lot of room for more furniture in the communal spaces. There is ample storage space including a basement, loft and space in the garden to keep your bike safe.We have a cleaning rota, so we're looking for someone prepared to do their bit once a month.RENT & BILLS* The rent/bills total for both rooms is currently ¬£740 pcm ALL IN (inc. council tax, TV license and fibre broadband).**Deposit is ¬£600 which you'll need to pay to secure the room. This is non-negotiable, if you don't pay the deposit when offered the room we will offer it to someone else.*** A ¬£50 tenancy swap fee will be split equaly between the incoming and outcoming tenant.**** We'd like to find someone by 14 Dec but there is wiggle room. You will only pay rent from the day you take over the room so if you move in during that the middle of the period both you and the outgoing tenant will pay less than a full month's rent.ROOMThe room comes unfinished and is south-facing with high ceilings overlooking the garden. It has wooden floorboards and an ornamental fireplace.AREAHarringay is a great area with lots of shops, restaurants and bars and cafes within 5mins walk. We also have the best Turkish food there is on offer. Hackney and Stoke Newington are a short bus ride away, and Finsbury Park Tube is just around the corner, but the actual park (which is beautiful) is 10mins walk away. We also have Turnpike Lane 10mins walk away and Haringay overground nearby.We look forward to meeting you!Sophie, Alex and Elliot :)

detail: Generous double in a quiet 4 bed house sharing with two/three other people and one cat.Most of the time you will be sharing with my brother Matthew, our lovely long term lodger Natalia and her cat Vanya. I will probably only be home for 2-3 months during the summer.My brother generally keeps to himself and has his own bathroom so probably won't see him a lot.Natalia is an author and copywriter. She is kind and considerate and is always up for a chat over a cup of tea but is also very respectful of personal space.I am a wildlife vet currently doing my PhD on leopards in Nepal. I won't be around that much at all. But when I am, very up for getting to know each other and similarly equally happy to give you your space.The room on offer is my old room, and you would be taking it while I‚Äôm away doing fieldwork (due to continue for another 2-3 years). It has a huge bed (super king) with plenty of storage and natural light. There is the option to add a desk if needed. I was initially only offering it until the end of June, but have now decided to let it long term. (I will use the box room when I'm there).There is also a large kitchen, with a big table and plenty of fridge space. Plus, a cosy sitting room with a wood burner and projector.The garden at the back is very green and full of wildlife (birds and squirrels mostly) and there's a deck for chilling with a coffee and a book.Rent is inclusive of all bills including council tax (band D) and we have a weekly cleaner for the common areas.We aren‚Äôt accepting any additional pets, but Vanya is super friendly and always ready with a nuzzle at the end of a long day.Ideally, we‚Äôd be looking for someone of a similar age, who‚Äôs clean and tidy and not looking for a massive party house, although thats not to say you can't host or have people over.

detail: In January 2026, I'm moving to Germany for a new role and am looking for a new tenant to take over my double room in a full house in Newington Green.About The Room:The double room comes furnished with double bed, mattress, and wardrobe. I'm happy to leave the desk and mirror for the new tenant as well (for a nominal fee). It sits on the first floor half landing and is a very good size!About The House:There are currently 5 (2 other males, 2 females) of us in the house working full-time in Insurance, Tech, and/or Finance. Or 6 if you count Margaux, the Border Terrier!As we already have been in the tenancy for a year or so, we've fully furnished the house - so there's not too much leftover space to bring in more furniture. Thankfully, there is plenty of space to be social, cook some great meals, but also enough to switch off for alone time.The house is on a quiet street just behind Newington Green with easy access to Clissold Park. There is a Tesco Express c. 5 min walk away. As for connections, lots of buses from Newington Green go directly into the city/Soho/Waterloo directly. Canonbury Station is a 5 minute walk away and Highbury & Islington is a 15-20 minute walk.Best local pubs include Lady Mildmay and the Snooty Fox. Some of our favourite local restaurants (where we'll sometimes have a house meal) include Jolene, Il Bacio, and Adana. There are also a local cheesemonger, butcher, fishmonger and plenty of caf√©s very nearby.The Monthly Costs:The rent is ¬£1,000 per month.All other bills amount to an additional ¬£206 per month.These bills include:- Electricity and Gas- Internet (Fibre Optic)- TV License- Council Tax (Band F)- Water- Weekly cleaning of communal areasThe new tenant will need to pay a 5-week deposit upon moving in to the estate agent and go through the usual right-to-rent and referencing checks.Every 2 months, we do a big Amazon shop for all household items that comes to another ¬£25 each. We maintain a joint house Monzo account to help with all of this where we transfer the funds and direct debits are set up through there.Ideal new tenant starting date is 7th January 2026 (until 7th October 2026 with option to renew), but there is flexibility so don't be afraid to reach out if interested! Reach out directly if you want to see a video of the key communal areas and the room itself.
